Becoming addicted to the computer leads to serious consequences. For example, you spend less time exercising and that isn't healthy for your body physically. Not exercising leads to many things like being overweight, health problems, diseases like diabetes, and many other things, but usually these are the main problems. You can avoid this by turning off the computer and just going for a small walk, but because of what computers have to offer these days, people don't want to do this. Another reason for why computers have a negative impact on society is because you won't spend as much time with your friends and family. Even if you don't realize it, if you spend more time on the computer than with your family and friends, this affects them in many ways. They can feel disappointed, worried about you, even concerned. When you're always on the computer, you're ignoring your family and this hurts them emotionally. Think about how you would feel if you had a best friend you always hung out with. You two did everything together, and then all of a sudden your best friend suddenly stops calling you, visiting you, and hanging out with you. You would feel disappointed because you lost your best friend over a computer. These things can happen if you go overboard when using the computer. These days, computers have all the websites like @CAPS1, @CAPS2, Twitter, and others. There are so many kids who chat with people they don't even know. Also, they're posting pictures of themselves without even thinking that this is a dangerous thing to do. Once you post those pictures, they will always be there no matter if you even try to delete them. Another thing is that when you're on the computer, people don't even think about their safety and that's how things happen. For example, you can think you're talking to a friend but as it turns out, you were talking to some stranger. Then you go meet up with your "friend" when it really wasn't. So you see, safety is a real big problem with these computers. In conclusion, do you still believe that computers are a good benefit for society or a bad benefit? My opinion still remains the same and I'm sure that there are others who believe the same. So this is why I think that computers are a bad benefit for society, and that computers can lead to more harm than do any good for people who use the computer.

The screen of the computer interacts in some way with the human brain and if stared at for too long the screen could permanently damage the brain. A University of Tech student, who studies computer mechanics, quoted, "We should help prevent brain damage by limiting the use of computers to only what needs to be done. So, in the end, people should know that computers are not beneficial. Computers affect people for sure, but not in a way that people would want to be affected. Addiction and distraction from the computer could cause important work to be ignored. Children and adults do not need to learn or be influenced by inappropriate language on the computer. Brain damage could be a serious problem that could be caused by something as simple as looking at a computer screen. Therefore, try to prevent all these negative effects by limiting the use of your computer. It is very easy to stay clear of any negative effects, but it is your choice whether to do so or not.

Computers and modern technology are advancing at a rapid pace, and an increasing number of people are beginning to embrace them. Some individuals claim that computers have a negative influence on children. I hold the opposite view. I firmly believe that computers represent an astonishing breakthrough in modern science. I am convinced that computers are perfect for schoolwork and communicating with others, as long as they are utilized in moderation. Computers simplify school projects to such an extent that I can't imagine how we could manage without them. Our social studies teacher, Mr. Johnson, states that 80% of his projects involve something related to the computer. The internet is an excellent resource for conducting research on large papers and projects. With over thirty - million educational and informational websites, it's effortless to quickly and easily locate the information you need. Once you've completed your research, typing up your report is a breeze. If it's not a written report, there are numerous other programs available for creating elaborate presentations. Take Microsoft PowerPoint as an example: you can design exotic backgrounds and texts, as well as unique animations to emphasize key points or make your presentation stand out. Computers are also an ideal means of communicating with friends and family. Emailing is fast and convenient for conveying your thoughts to others. If you wish to chat, you can use Skype or instant messaging. These options enable you to type and send messages even faster. Both of these programs offer an innovative way to communicate with a family member who is away from home. For instance, if my dad travels to Tokyo on business, we can exchange emails daily. And now, with Zoom (a video - chat service), you can see the person and have a real - time conversation as if they were right at home. Computers have their advantages, but they also come with disadvantages. They are great for communication and schoolwork, but excessive use can be detrimental to health. Here's an example: my older brother, Tom, is a senior in high school. He is at school from 8 am to 4 pm, and as soon as he gets home, he heads straight for his computer. He spends at least five hours on it every night, leaving little time for dinner and hardly any time for sleep. I believe that computers are a remarkable invention in modern technology, as long as people set limits for themselves. Computers are constantly introducing new features, and who knows what they'll be like in the future.

I completely agree with those who believe that computers have a negative impact on us today. Although computers are remarkable, they do have numerous adverse effects on users. With the advent of new technology, people can take pictures and post them on websites where everyone can view them. Additionally, there are computer games that people can become addicted to. Lastly, there are online predators. The new technology is truly amazing, such as webcams for video - chatting or cellphones for taking pictures. However, they do have negative consequences. There have been numerous suicides resulting from cyber - bullying. This occurs when people harass kids over the internet. Some individuals even send nude pictures online or during webcam sessions. This is not only illegal but also absurd that young or even older people would engage in such behavior. There are also websites where people can post very personal pictures of you, which can have a profound impact on your life. Many people have computer games or download them from websites. Most individuals actually become addicted to these games. They would play them all day if possible, and when they're not playing, they're constantly thinking about it. This causes them to miss out on a lot of things. They may not get enough exercise, neglect their homework, which will lead to a decline in grades. They might also spend less time with their families. It can even change a person's personality. The most crucial aspect of using computers is safety. There are predators all over the internet who can pretend to be someone from school and ask for your address. You should never disclose your address or full name online. They could very likely come to your home, which could endanger your life or that of your family members. Computers can be enjoyable, and you can learn a vast amount of information from them, but only if you use them wisely. Remember not to tell anyone where you live and avoid sending personal pictures. They could spread across the internet overnight. Lastly, prioritize your family, grades, and health over some useless game. Be smart and stay safe!

Dear Newspaper, I firmly believe that people need computers. They can help those who are unable to travel physically or mentally to see the world. They can also be used to send extremely important messages to people who are far away. Moreover, if someone has a loved one who is at a distant location, computers allow them to stay connected. Here are some examples of these three benefits. Some people are either physically or mentally unable to travel and can't afford to do so. It's truly sad that some individuals are so ill with a disease or illness that they can't leave their homes. However, by going online, they can look up pictures and information about places they've never visited, which can help them gain a better understanding of the world. There are also people who have fears that prevent them from traveling. The internet can offer resources to help them overcome these fears, enabling them to eventually travel and experience the world firsthand. Additionally, the internet can assist in finding a well - paying job, which can provide the means to afford travel. What if you need to send a critically important message to someone to prevent them from making a grave mistake, save a life, or even stop a war? Consider a situation where a war is raging due to a misunderstanding. If the government discovers the truth and knows how to resolve the situation, they can send a message to the attackers, explaining what actually happened and that it wasn't what they thought. This could potentially stop the fighting and end the war. Or, imagine if a bomb is discovered in the White House. A person who finds out about it can send a message to the authorities in the building, which could save the lives of everyone inside. Sometimes, loved ones go to far - off places, and it becomes difficult to communicate or see them. For example, if someone in the military has a child, the computer allows them to see and talk to their child via a webcam, keeping the parent - child bond intact. Also, if you see an old friend on Facebook whom you haven't seen in years, you can send them a friend request and rekindle your friendship. In conclusion, computers can perform many helpful functions. They can mend relationships, save lives, help people overcome fears, and enable them to see the world. While we may sometimes overuse them, they are extremely useful. They are not entirely bad; they have their drawbacks, but overall, they are a valuable tool.

Dear local newspaper, Hello, my name is Sarah. I've just learned about how people perceive computers and their effects. Moreover, the only nature they experience is through online pictures, rather than enjoying the full beauty of the real world. Another negative consequence is that they become increasingly distant from their loved ones. What has happened to our society? Why can't we think independently anymore? I sincerely and strongly hope that what I'm saying will change some people's minds. Thank you very much. Exercise is a vital part of anyone's life, especially for growing kids and teens. When you're on the computer, what exercise benefits do you gain? Stronger fingers? A higher risk of carpal - tunnel syndrome. "80% of kids with health problems like obesity have access to the internet," according to Dr. Smith of the, "Healthy Living Institute" in Huntington Beach, California. When you immerse yourself in the computer world, you probably don't even think about staying fit. Instead, you might munch on some chips while typing. What health benefits do these computer activities offer? With the threat of global warming, what you saw in nature yesterday might not be there tomorrow. Breathing in fresh, natural air can really soothe a stressed - out child. Whatever happened to playing with sidewalk chalk, tag, or just running around outside? Is it no longer considered cool? It seems that taking care of oneself is no longer in vogue. You could inspire yourself by writing poems about your feelings or drawing a landscape. Nowadays, instead of climbing a tree, we're using our mouse to click to the next website. There's so much that we take for granted, and one day, when you look back, you'll really miss those care - free days. Family time is extremely important in anyone's life. Without a family, you're lost. When did game night or family time disappear? Just because our society has made computers a common household item doesn't mean that family and friends should no longer be a top priority. If you want to hang out at a friend's house, don't just email about it. Walk over there and experience the full interaction. Since when does a computer replace a family? Never. If we step out of this fake digital reality, we can eliminate negativity from our lives. We can regain a true and meaningful life with our loved ones. We'd think more clearly, just by disconnecting. What makes a computer better than real life? Absolutely nothing. Ask yourself that question. In conclusion, I firmly believe that our excessive use of computers has made us less capable. The negatives far outweigh the positives. Sure, you can quickly send a message or play a game, but isn't it sometimes better to do things the old - fashioned way, like making a phone call or writing a letter? I once again thank you for taking the time to read this. Whether I've changed your mind or not, think about these things the next time you're online.

Dear Readers, in today's modern world, almost everyone owns a computer. While this can be seen as a positive development, it mostly has an unnatural impact on our lives.  Computers have enabled people to do things that were previously impossible. For example, when people move to a different location, they no longer need to send letters and wait days for a reply. Now, they can simply sign into platforms like AIM, Facebook, or MySpace and have instant conversations. However, these are just the positive aspects. There are numerous negative consequences.  People are spending less time outdoors and are no longer appreciating the beauty of nature. We rarely spend quality time with our friends in person. I can hardly recall the last time I had a face - to - face conversation with someone unless it was absolutely necessary.  The anonymity of the internet allows people to do as they please. You might think this is a good thing, but it's not. People can hack into various systems, cyberbully others without being identified, and assume false identities. For instance, if I were @NUM1 and I wanted to stalk a @NUM2 - year - old, I could pretend to be ten and befriend the child. Once I gather enough information, I could potentially locate the child. This kind of behavior was not possible before the widespread use of computers.  If people start to recognize the negative impacts on our lives, more of them will stop being overly attached to their computers. They will reduce the amount of time spent on the computer and start living a more balanced life. We need to take action, be more aware, and spread the word about the importance of limiting computer use. By doing so, we can regain a more natural and fulfilling way of life.

Overall, computers are one of the most useful and common of the learning devices. Many people say that computers are useful. Studies show that 80% of people with bad spelling or grammatical habits corrected their mistakes quickly through PowerPoint and Word. If people constantly make grammatical or spelling errors, then having them underlined in Word will show them that this is not the correct way to punctuate or spell something in a sentence. Dear local Newspaper, I have heard that there is a controversy over whether computers benefit our society. The postal service is slow, and the telephone can be expensive, especially for long - distance calls. Why wouldn't you want a computer? What happens if a hurricane is approaching, and a family has no idea of its presence? All they need to do is check their email or the internet to realize what danger they are in. Calling somebody is risky because they might not be able to answer for any reason, such as a power outage. In a situation like this, computers become essential to everyone. Without a doubt, the fun and helpful features of computers, such as games, help us out.  Although some say that computers aren't needed, they help us throughout our lives. Computers are very enhanced pieces of machinery. With this high - tech object comes knowledge of many different places and what is happening around the world. Through various news platforms and information websites on the computer, one can access a vast amount of global news instantly. Next, typing is a universal way of writing that is much faster than hand - written pieces. Typing on a keyboard allows for quick input and easy editing. Lastly, online gaming is a convenient and fun way to relieve stress by interacting with other users around the world. These are thousands of news snippets every day of the year that do not ultimately get covered because of limited air - time on news channels. To quickly and simply get your news from around the world you can visit a website and look at hundreds of stories at the click of a button. To add to that, you will get more in - depth news as there is no limit on room or space on the website. These websites will even be areas on the website to donate to those that need assistance. Patrick Johnson, founder of the Global Aid Foundation, stated, "Online fundraising brings in billions of dollars in aid to people who otherwise would be in deep trouble, and the main source of all of this money is from internet websites." Without the internet, millions of people would not even know about these people who desperately need help. Typing is a quick and fairly simple way to write, that saves people valuable time. Teachers often assign writing homework, which takes about twice as long to hand - write other than type. Using typing would save you this time and allow you to continue on with other important tasks that are needed to be completed. Furthermore, typing is a mandatory class for many freshmen and previous experience is very helpful to the teachers and students. "I've had many students," says typing instructor Ms. Smith, "and the ones that excel not only get an 'A', but also cut their homework time in half." Stress is a common problem in all age groups, and a computer is the best way to relieve it. Interactive games with people around the world will broaden your spectrum to other cultures. You may use your typing skills to talk with others, and share your opinions with them. "Online gaming may seem a shock," says Dr. Brown at Tech University, "but people who use computers an hour a day are much more culturally advanced than the others." To add to that, you can use video chat to talk to people in foreign areas. Friends, family, and exchange students are able to talk and see you through video chat. This greatly reduces parents' worry of their children living in a foreign country. Many people can benefit from the various functions of computers in their daily lives.

Dear Readers, I believe that spending time on the computer has its pros and cons. In conclusion, while computers offer many advantages, we should also be aware of their drawbacks and use them in a balanced way.

First, computers have its benefits to society because it can teach or give you the social skills you need. On a computer, you can interact with others from around the world and make new friends. Through online forums, social media platforms, and chat rooms, you can engage in diverse conversations. Therefore, you can learn about their culture and what they do in their country. Also, you can talk and interact with family that does not live with you or is not with you at the moment. You can have video calls, share photos and updates, and maintain a close relationship. So as you can see, Computers have its benefits because it can teach you social skills. Next, the benefits it has to society is people can learn things online. For example, you can learn how to use a computer if you don't already know how. There are numerous online tutorials and courses available. Also, you could play online learning games for free or buy a @CAPS3 with more advanced options for learning. Another example is you can look up recent or past events you want to know about and conduct in - depth research. You can access a vast amount of information from reliable sources. So as you can see, Computers benefit society because you can learn all types of things online. Finally, computers have its benefits because it teaches you hand - eye coordination. For example, you can find all types of games using hand - eye coordination using the mouse and keyboard. These games require you to react quickly and precisely. Also, if you just want time to pass by, you can use the computer as entertainment by chatting with others and playing games. Believe it or not, you can find a large number of jobs that use a computer for any of these skills. As you can see, computers have its benefits because it teaches you hand - eye coordination and gives you some free - time entertainment. In conclusion, computers have its benefits to the social community. First, it helps you learn your social skills. Next, you can learn about any subject online for free if you're not the one paying the internet bill. Finally, it benefits you by teaching you hand - eye coordination. So as you can see, I @CAPS2 that computers benefit society in plenty of ways, making them an important part of our modern lives.

Dear Newspaper, Computers are not something to be afraid of. They help many people in different ways, like the office workers, teachers, students, scientists, and locals dealing with their jobs and daily life. Hasn't a computer already helped you today? Because of that, computers help us learn, keep in contact with people, and are our future. Who has said that by using computers you don't interact with your family as much? Well, I can tell you that I'm staying in contact with my grandma, cousins, and aunts through my e - mail. With e - mail you can check up on news or simply write to friends and family! Also, if you are planning a trip to visit your loving family members, don't bother with a map that gets in your face all the time and you just "happen" to get lost, try going on Google maps and plan the shortest route to your destination without getting lost along the way. Computers can do more than creating a simple map, it can give you precious information! Many schools across the country use computers to help teach kids. The kids can look up historical events and in just a few seconds they have all the information they need! In most school papers, you have to type and provide what websites you used to achieve finishing the paper. What is also nice is that you don't need to go through huge books for one small piece of information. It is much easier, looking it up on the computer. Speaking of not using big books for information, computers don't use paper and will lead us to a healthier tomorrow! Millions of tons of paper land in landfills each day! By using computers we could read online and conserve paper! Another fantastic fact is that computers will grow in the future. People have already created touch - screen computers and computers will grow even more! Many people think that using computers is a bad thing, but look at the facts! Doesn't the newspaper write the newspaper on computers? If they didn't, they would be having hand cramps all the time! And what about doctors, don't they have your medical history on the computer? If not, all these papers would get lost! Like in the beginning, computers help us learn, keep in contact with people, and are our future, and we should embrace them with open arms.

Typing and surfing the web can be exciting; however, is it worth the health risks that there are now? Before computers were discovered, human's healthiness was triple than what it is now. Computers can be useful and indeed have some benefits; on the other hand, they are harmful and they should not be used as often. They have unprofessional websites, they are not helpful when it comes to exercise, and they disturb individual's privacy. Young kids are let onto computers every day and they wander to the websites that the internet has to offer. Consequently, kids end up in inappropriate websites that they are not meant to be on. In fact, a significant percentage of kids enter unprofessional websites and a large portion of them have no parental supervision in the room alone. Therefore, young kids act up in homes and at school. However, kids are not the only ones who are affected by this. Computers have a disadvantage of being hacked or virused from uncensored websites. Moreover, computers crash or don't allow use of computer documents because of these viruses. Ever since the internet was invented, obesity and lack of exercise in a person's schedule has skyrocketed. A scientist, named Dr. Smith from the local research institute, said, "Heavy computer users have lost their use of muscles, but they have gained over a considerable amount of fat causing a lot of them to not be able to do activities they did before." I believe that this is definitely true because I remember that the same happened to my sister. She ate more and her exercise time was spent more on the computer than on her body. I know that some say that computers help in hand - eye coordination, however, is it really worth more than someone's healthy body? Many things are sold on the internet that are not in stores, but you don't trust the internet when buying these products. You don't trust the internet because you have heard so much about someone's identity or money taken away from them. In conclusion, we should be more cautious about our computer use to safeguard our health and privacy.

Dear Local Newspaper, Computers are harmfully affecting the children, and they are going to affect future generations even more. Computers are fine in moderation, as are most things. If they are needed for a school project that's fine, but using the computer everyday rather than exercising is not okay. Supporters of technology say that computers have a positive effect. I have to disagree. They say they practice hand - eye coordination, they can teach you about far away places and you can talk with people online. Sports are a great way to exercise and practice hand - eye coordination. Tennis, baseball, basketball, hockey, etc are all great sports that practice hand - eye coordination. They are much healthier than IMing your friends all day. You sit on your butt all day and scream to your mom to get you a drink of water, or some dinner. "Future generations are becoming way too dependent." says Mr. Johnson, my 5th grade science teacher. How are you supposed to be able to support a family when you're older if you can't get up from the computer. "Raising a family is hard work," my mom tells me, "your family needs food which means someone needs a job, and someone also needs to get the food. That takes a lot of time and energy." I agree with my mom, and if simple things like going outside for an hour a day are practiced as a child, having a job and raising a family will be easier. Rather than searching the internet for how to find a good online source to support your thesis paper go to the library! The internet is a relatively new data basis. However, it has grown so much. You cannot always trust internet sources. People who might have posted the website could very well be crazy. Plus websites are filled with viruses, and what happens when your computer is dead due to viruses and you actually need your computer for a school project? The simple alternative would be going to the local library and checking out a variety of books. The books are trusted and filled with information. The internet is also not a very safe place. Facebook, AIM, email, twitter, etc are all ways for people to communicate through the computer. Facebook, AIM and twitter are scary and not safe because you might not know who you are talking to. They do have a profile which you might be able to relate to, but they could be lying. "The internet is a broad place open to strangers," my dad says. I am not allowed to have these ways to communicate because of the specific reasons that I stated earlier. My parents are doing this to protect me and I agree with their decision. Rather than talking to complete strangers go over to your friends' house. Your friends are the people that you want to talk to and spend time with. Overall, computers are bizarre pieces of technology that can be unsafe, not truthful, and are forcing children to become more dependent on adults. I have to disagree with the supporters of technology. There are many healthy alternatives to the computer. I believe that experts who are concerned that people are spending too much time on the computer and less time exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with family and friends are right. We should choose the healthier alternatives for a better life.

Dear local news paper, I think the computers benefit society. The three reasons why so is because computers teach hand - eye coordination, give people the ability to learn about faraway places, and allow people to talk online with other people, and computers help to make better technology. I believe that computers have a positive effect on people. My first reason why computers have a positive effect on people is because computers teach hand - eye coordination and give people the ability to learn about faraway places. 3 out of 5 students use the computers to do homework. I was visiting a prompt last week. I didn't know a lot about ancient Egypt so I went on the computers and you know what, I got to know more about ancient Egypt and thanks to the computers I got an A+. So the computers have a positive effect on people. The next reason why computers have a positive effect on people is because computers allow people to talk online with other people. Say if a man went on a business trip and he left his phone at home, how will he talk to his family? Well, he had computers, he can talk to his family online. My family is back in Italy. I haven't seen them in four years so I went to the store and got a webcam and I got to see my family after four years. So computers do have a positive effect on people. My last reason why computers have a benefit in society is because computers help to make better technology. Computers help people to make better cars, lights, and so on. Without computers, society would be at a disadvantage because computers help the soldiers to win wars and even help people to live. My father was dying from a heart condition. Without the computer - assisted medical equipment, my father would die. Thanks to the computer, I have my father today. In the end, computers have benefits in society. The three reasons are computers teach hand - eye coordination, give people the ability to learn about faraway places, and computers allow people to talk online with other people and computers help people to make better technology. Spending time enjoying nature is good, but computers have benefited society greatly. I hope my three reasons can persuade the local news paper to agree with my position that computers have a positive effect on people, and we should continue to develop and utilize them for a better future.

Student Reporter: John Doe, Editor: 1, Reporter: 2, To the Editor of the local newspaper, I think we should have computers because they would help us meet new people, see new places, and learn new things. It would help us meet new people because we can e - mail them, and chat with them on various programs. It will also help us see new places because we can go on the internet and look up different places to see virtual tours and detailed information. It will also help us learn about new things because we can talk to experts and enthusiasts from around the world, and they could give us some ideas on what to learn about. This will help us all because we want to learn about new things, talk to new people and see new places. This is a good idea for all of us. We can all benefit from this because it's a great thing for everyone to have. I think we should have computers because it would help us meet new people, see new places, and learn new things. This is a great thing for everyone, not just some people. I hope you take this letter into consideration. Because it will help everyone learn about new things and expand their horizons, making our community more informed and connected.

I think computers are bad because people use them constantly to access Facebook and other websites that are sometimes a complete waste of time. Instead of spending excessive hours on the computer, people should venture outside, go for refreshing walks, explore the enchanting woods, and engage in regular exercise. Most people do not get the sufficient amount of exercise they need because they are glued to their computers. To address this issue, people should stop over - producing computers so that fewer individuals will use them. This way, people can exercise more and shed some extra weight. If the production of computers were to decrease, some people would stop visiting inappropriate websites. People should only use the computer for legitimate purposes such as researching for school projects or typing papers for homework. Both parents and kids need to exercise to maintain good health. No one wants to develop diabetes at a young age, so it is truly important to exercise to prevent such health problems. All the computer does is disrupt your normal routine and make you less likely to exercise. So, get off the computer, exercise, explore the outdoors, go for walks, and discover the wonders of the woods. You never know what amazing things you might find in the woods, like different kinds of bugs and insects. You might even spot a cute ladybug. There are all sorts of bees, and you might find one that looks truly unique. So, go outside and explore. You'll be surprised by what you find. When you go for walks, you'll see different kinds of houses, each with its own distinct color and style. There are small, medium, and large houses, and some will have very interesting color combinations. You'll also encounter different animals like dogs and cats, either in the windows or playing outside. You should go out and hang out with your family, friends, or both, and observe the beauty of nature. You could take pictures and create a scrapbook to cherish these memories. Just go into the woods and take a stroll. Once you start getting out and exercising, you'll think to yourself that you should do this more often instead of being on the computer. After all, you'll have more fun hanging out with loved ones and getting exercise at the same time, and the computer will just seem boring in comparison.

Dear Local Newspaper, My opinion on the effects computers have on people is that computers have a good effect. It's great for education, mental exercise, and communication all over the world. However, it could also be bad because it would keep you from getting proper exercise, spending quality time with your family, and maintaining good health. But I still think that there are ways to use computers without experiencing the negative consequences. Some ways computers are beneficial for you are that you can obtain a better education when you have access to websites with a vast amount of information. Sometimes this information may be false, but if you know how to find reliable websites, you can get the right information. With all of this information at your fingertips, you can exercise your mind to achieve better results in life. You can also talk to people on the other side of the earth and gain more information from them. If I were to say computers are bad for you, I would say that it keeps you from getting enough, or maybe any, exercise. Computers might be the reason why there are so many obese people in the country. When computers are used too much, people distance themselves from their family and immerse themselves in different fantasy worlds that sometimes get you addicted to them. And staying on the computer for too long causes problems. You can get hurt by just sitting for a long period of time at once. Being on the computer for too long can also cause eye problems where you will begin to lose your sight and will need glasses, which will get thicker as you keep looking at the computer screen for hours and days. But even though computers cause so many problems, we can prevent them by using the computer to help us. People don't get enough exercise, but with the help of computers, they can find suitable times and ways to exercise so that they can stay healthy. They can also find information about how much time should be spent on the computer to avoid a decrease in sight or worse. Some people live far away from their family, so computers really help them stay in touch and be able to see each other. In conclusion, I think that computers are more beneficial than harmful because they provide you with a lot of information on various topics and you can communicate with people all over the world. And computers can help you prevent those things that are bad for you by showing you ways to use the computer that won't harm you.

Dear newspaper, I heard you were discussing if more and more people using computers was a benefit to society. I believe that excessive computer use has a negative affect on people. They get to interact with people who aren't safe, they spend less time exercising, and they get into more trouble than before. Spending a large amount of time online in chat rooms causes people to meet potential predators. Take my friend Lisa; she was online one day when a man started to talk to her. She thought he seemed acceptable when he said he was 25 and a model. She flirted with him day after day until one day her friend logged on and found out the man was really 45 and a pervert. Lisa isn't the only one that this has happened to. 30 out of 50 people in chat rooms say they have been lied to like this. Website designer Mr. Smith says, "More and more people everyday are falling for lies over the internet and getting in sticky situations like getting asked to meet the person." Isn't it the saying "Don't talk to strangers?" Spending all your time sitting down on the computer means less time outside exercising. At tryouts, this girl Sarah wasn't in shape enough to keep up with the players. Instead of practicing like the rest of us, she was in her house talking on Facebook. She wasn't prepared when tryout time came, so she didn't make the softball team. The next year she made captain because she was out training every day before the big day. She's not the only one with a laziness problem. 40 out of every 100 Americans are couch potatoes and choose to go online rather than stay in shape. Nutritionalist, Dr. Brown says, "This generation is worse than the last. They complain when they can't do something, but that's because instead of going outside, they're on their butts watching TV or online." Computer use is a breath of fresh air? What do you have to lose by getting off it? Kids seem to get in a lot more trouble online than they ever have on the streets. They're out posting threats, dissing each other, sending personal messages or pictures, and worst of all, sometimes hurting someone so bad that the victim commits suicide. One year, the neighbor was more popular than this lady's daughter, so she created an online persona that the neighbor fell for. The online "guy" began trashing the teenage girl so badly that she ended up hanging herself. People, including singer Justin Bieber, have been caught in sexting. It's embarrassing, inappropriate, and against the law, yet it still happens. These people are not alone. 30 out of 50 people have gotten in big trouble through the internet. Governor, Mr. Johnson says, "The internet and phones are destroying this society. There's too much real - life drama already." Can't you see something wrong with all of this? My opinion on excessive computer use is that we should use the computers less before we all start interacting with people that will scare us, become couch potatoes, and get into huge trouble. It's really not worth the damage of getting scared, hurt, lazy, or taking your own life.

Dear newspaper, Computers are everywhere in our nation. We have them at home, at school or at our work. Many people believe that computers are bad for our health or we don't spend enough time with our family. But I disagree. Computers teach hand - eye coordination, let us learn about faraway places, and also allow us to chat online with other people. Have you ever had trouble with hand - eye coordination? Sometimes mine is really poor! But when I get on a computer, it gets much better. Experts say that 30% more people with hand - eye coordination have improved by working with a computer. A teacher at our school said, "My students have been working on the computers for about two months now and I have seen an incredible improvement in their hand - eye coordination already." I agree with these experts too. So many people nowadays who have a computer have passed their hand - eye coordination test! When I grow up and soon get out of high school, I want to travel all over the world. But first, I want to be educated on where I go. That is why computers are so helpful. I can just click on a button and the internet will bring me to hundreds of sites where I can learn all about the places I want to visit. One time, my parents told me we were going to Paris for the day. So the night before, I did a bunch of research on different shops, museums, and places to eat. The computer helped me so much that if we didn't have it, then I don't know where we would go. President Obama said, "One time when I had a big meeting in Tokyo, I had no knowledge about it. So I logged on to the computer and it brought me to a million pages on their culture, language, and much more. I don't know what I would do if I didn't have a computer." I love talking to my friends. But once I'm home, none of my friends are around me, so I have nobody to talk to. If I also don't have the phone available, then that makes it even worse. But, if I go on the computer, then I can talk to a bunch of my friends. I can go onto my webcam to see who I am talking to or I can go onto another website to get an instant message. I love talking online because one of my best friends in the whole world moved down to Florida, so I don't get to talk to her very often. But if I go to the instant message website, then I can talk to her as much as I want. 80 out of 100 people surveyed said that they have someone they talk to over the internet. So I say the computer is important in our society. It helps complete a number of tasks. They teach hand - eye coordination, give people the ability to learn about faraway places, and it even allows people to talk to friends and family online. So I don't think computers are bad for us or our health. I think they are important and needed for a well - rounded life.

Dear, editor of the newspaper. I believe that computers are good for the future. The world has made many changes with its technology. I know not spending time exercising is bad, but learning about new things can't be that bad. If humans didn't have technology, some of us wouldn't have heat or fresh water. We use computers in every aspect of life. Computers are good for people who use them to learn about the world. Some people who have friends far away can use a computer to talk to them. Or even people who can't talk use computers to communicate for them. The medical field uses computers to save lives. Computers save lives in so many ways that it's scary to think if they were all gone, we could all start facing serious problems. We use computers in hospitals. For example, if there weren't any computers, the chances of finding a cure for something would take too long and the patient could die. Let's say someone has what looks like a normal fever and you just assume that's what it is. Two days later, they die because they had some rare disease and no one knew until it was too late. We use computers to purify water, ensuring that we have clean and safe drinking water. We use computers to keep us warm during winter by controlling heating systems. We even use computers in libraries. Why the library? Some people who have medical illnesses and can't talk have these small computers that can have something typed in them and it will speak the words. Most people use some kind of computer to talk, chat, and text. They might find it easier with a computer. The world is a big place, and many people don't know much about it. But if you go online, you could find out stuff that you might never knew existed or just plainly didn't know about. Kids even use computers for school and schoolwork. So many people rely on technology to get through their life. Computers even help people in school, like me who broke my arm and have to take some tests on the computer. Now, so many things in the military, airforce, and navy are computerized. The military uses thermal sights on guns and tanks so they can identify people in even the most extreme weather conditions. It can even locate a wounded soldier. They are even working with computers to make better bullet - proof vests so that more lives will be saved in war. The airforce uses computers to talk to people on the ground so they can protect them. They now have planes that can be flown by a pilot far away, which would save their lives even if the plane gets shot down. This also allows them to see people hiding and they can tell the people on the ground to stay down or take appropriate action. The navy uses radar, which is computer - controlled, to see if there are any boats or submarines coming near them and they have a heads - up if there would be an attack. We use this technology to help with other advances in the future. We could soon have a computer that could help out people in far - off places where there is a higher poverty rate. Computers save lives, allow communication, and are a great way for research. Computers are what we use to live, and we truly need them to survive in this modern world.

Some "experts" are warned that people should not spend too much time on their computers. Yet, look at all of the numerous advantages that a computer offers. You can develop better hand - eye coordination skills, interact via the internet with friends or family who could live hundreds of miles away, and you can learn about diverse cultures all around the world, along with the unique people who live in those countries, without ever leaving the comfort of your home. In my opinion, computers overall benefit society, helping us learn more and more every single day. First off, there are many useful skills you can develop on the computer. For example, when playing interactive high - paced games, kids get a sense of awareness, precise timing, and excellent hand - eye coordination. Not to mention, with new advances in technology, people can now go to college without ever leaving home, and at a much lower price, while still getting a great quality education. Many people even work from home, thanks to their reliable computers. These are still only a few of the many skills that can be learned on computers. Secondly, why buy an expensive ticket to a far - away country, trade in all your money for the money they have there, and go through the hassles of baggage, etc. When you could simply go online and look it up on the computer? You can go online, look up some of that country's delicious recipes, beautiful language, amazing pictures, and interesting people without the hassle of going there. Not to mention, for kids who aren't old enough to travel to a particular place, or have to do a report on it, instead of rummaging through countless textbooks, newspapers, and libraries in general, they go online, search for their country, and they have most, if not all the info they need right there. So not only is it convenient, but you're getting the information you would've learned in the first place, thereby, extending your knowledge. Finally, the internet helps people connect. Leading experts from the U.S.A., or Family security agency, says that since people have started using programs like Skype and facebook, many more families, who live in different countries, have been able to re - connect and get to know one - another. For example, if you have an uncle who lives in Australia, you could both buy cameras for your computer, install them, and within minutes, be seeing each other and talking face to face. I think this is better than simply writing letters to them, as it's quicker, and you get to connect more. Same goes if a friend or you move away, but want to stay in touch. A quick facebook account or Skype, and you'll still be good friends. So all in all, yes, computers do benefit society, as they help teach people skills, learn about distant cultures and far - away countries, and connect people, who might live in different countries. I don't see anything wrong with these beneficial factors to society. So yes, computers have a positive effect on people, enhancing our lives in multiple ways.

Dear Local newspaper, imagine a world filled with gargantuan people seated at a monitor, their eyes staring at it blankly. Outside, the city streets are deserted, save for the squirrels running along fence posts. This is what will happen if people spend too much time on the computers. People will spend less time exercising, less time outdoors enjoying nature, and less time interacting with family and friends. This is why computers have a drastic negative affect on people. First of all, people spend huge amounts of time on their computers and small amounts of time exercising. In a recent poll done by Health magazine, it stated that 70% of people between the ages of 10 and 20 prefer to be online rather than outside exercising. That article also states that since 2010, child obesity has increased by 30%! Dr. Smith of Pediatrics at Children's Hospital states that â€œthe reason child obesity has increased so much is because children spend so much time in front of the computer and less time outdoors. Do you want this rate to increase in the next ten years? Secondly, spending so much time inside decreases the time you spend outside enjoying nature. Bird Watcher's Monthly has had a decrease in subscriptions since 2015 because people are not interested in nature anymore. In a study done by Dr. Johnson and his colleagues at Environmental Research Institute, 80% of teenagers spend almost 50% more time indoors in front of electronic devices, most frequently computers, than they do outdoors. Dr. Brown says, â€œDue to the new advancements in technology, people tend to spend more time indoors than outdoors and that percentage will most likely increase as the decade proceedsâ€. Finally, spending so much time in front of the computer leaves you less time to interact with family and friends. In 2012, more than 80% of families ate dinner together. Now, only 40% eat together usually because they are in separate rooms in front of a monitor. This also leads to a higher crime rate, believe it or not. Because young children and adolescents don't have the person to support and guide them because they don't spend time together due to the frequent use of computers, there is a 20% chance that a child will commit a crime compared to the 5% chance a child would in 2010. Do you want that for our youth? Now imagine a world where people jog together in the park. As they jog, they see a group of bird watchers huddled together under a tree. As the joggers proceed, they come to a pavilion and see a big family celebrating the birthday of a family member. This happy thought won't become a reality if people spend too much time on their computers and less time exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with family and friends. So, local newspaper I encourage you, to encourage others, to get outside and spend less time in front of the computer. You have the power to make a difference in your real lives. But the question is, will you? By taking action, we can create a healthier and more connected community.

Dear @CAPS1 Newspaper, although computers have many benefits, they also have many faults too. I believe that computers and the technology these days have many more negative features than positive. Some of those faults are that it's bad for your eyes, you don't spend as much time with family and you exercise less, and the time you spend going outside is less often. Yeah, I get it that computers are very useful but they also harm your eyesight. If you haven't noticed, more and more kids have been getting glasses and contacts, due to the use of staring at a screen all day. I know more than 10 kids that have glasses now, I also know that over 5 parents I know now have glasses for the exact same reason. Using these computers is great for looking up your homework, but if you stay on it for over an hour or two a day you'll probably become addicted to it and eventually you'd lose your eyesight. The usual time a kid spends on their laptop a night is about 2 or 3 hours and the time they spend with their family is maybe an hour if the parents are lucky. Personally, I feel technology is the reason parents and kids are less connected. When the kids go on the computer, they go on Instagram or Snapchat and talk to friends that they see every day. So I don't find it necessary. Mostly the girls do this, but why not just talk to them in school since you see them for 6 hours everyday. The use of technology is being abused! The computers were invented for knowledge not scandalous "webchats" or "Snapchat pages." The world would be so much happier and mentally fit if we stuck to the original idea of technology. Now kids don't even take a quick step outside their bedroom after school, it's pointless! Most people even eat in their room so they can talk to people. So that's taking the parents' time away from their kids. Now that you have read what I had to say about technology these days, wouldn't you agree that it just takes time away from your actual life? I think it does and hope that you agree with me. We should all strive to use technology in a more balanced way to regain the quality of our real - life interactions.

Dear Newspaper Editor, I believe that the computer is good for the society because students do most of the studies online. We spend most of our time with our family and friends so we want a little bit of time to ourselves. We learn much more on the computer because it has a lot of accurate facts. After reading this essay I hope you will agree with my position. Students put most of their notes on a laptop and study what they did in class on the computer. When they need to look something up for history class they have the internet. High school students don't like going to the library so they go on the internet as their source. So when a student has a project due and the teacher wants it neat, the computer will write the project neatly. The computer/internet has become a big source of learning to our society, don't you agree? Our time is mostly spent with our families when our friends don't come over. We can go outside and play with them, sit down and play games. Having a little bit of time to ourselves on the computer won't hurt anyone. We don't use it forever. Computers are a bad habit, even though we might need them, it's better safe than sorry to do it the old - fashioned way.

Computers are a good benefit to society as they allow you to talk to people and give you different perspectives and the latest updates. First, they allow you to chat with friends at any time you want, breaking the barriers of distance. You can talk to people who are far away, even if you rarely see them in person. For example, if your friend lives on the other side of the globe, you can use your computer and message them so you can still talk to them all the time, sharing your daily experiences and feelings. Also, when you're bored, it will give you something to do. You could see if anyone wants to make plans to hang out. And if you just want to stay home all day, you can still interact with people in a virtual way. Secondly, it gives you new ideas on things. It shares different opinions. Maybe someone bought the same item you're considering and it did not work well for them. You could see the comments and reviews. Would you want to spend your money on something that did not work? I wouldn't. You can also see if the majority of people like what they got. Also, they make you think of something you would not think about before. Say you had a negative mark about how something was horrible. Maybe if you read the page about it online, it shows what you did wrong and what you did not do. It gives you the chance to try something you might enjoy. Lastly, it gives you the latest updates. It can share if the school schedule is closed, delayed, or open. You wouldn't have to wait for the news to show it. It can tell you about crimes that are happening in your area. Also, it tells you about your town. Who doesn't want to know what's going on in their own town? It tells you new things that are in your town or what they're going to build or it tells you what it is getting rid of. Computers are great as they let us chat with friends and family. It gives us thoughts we might have never thought about before and they tell us the newest updates, making our lives more connected and informed.

Dear Technology Society: Computers are perhaps one of the greatest improvements to our society's advancement in knowledge in the past few decades. These gems of the future are like a human being; they have their own "mind" and can figure out answers to all sorts of problems. People all around the world use them, from bustling Tokyo to serene Paris, to vibrant Sydney to historic Rome. Do you wish to be that one standing on the sidelines, stuck in the past, not advancing with technology? From the creations of rockets that soar into space, engines that power our vehicles, and planes that connect distant lands; computers have never let us down. Still, the question is this: will computerized technology benefit our society or crash it down? Ever since the invention of the first modern computer in 1946, computers have been used as an ad for new information. The speed at which they are able to receive new information is just astonishing! Dr. John Smith, a well - known computer engineer, says "With the technology that we receive from computers, we are able to be in the game." Dr. Smith just comes to show one of the best benefits of computers: their ability to display the most current information. Now, I can see how books are an excellent resource in society, and how they provide amazing information. However, it takes years to publish books! Not only will this allow you to get information faster, but it will also allow our society to "be in the game." You catch a football as it soars through the air, you track a baseball as it flies high in the sky, you grasp the face of a basketball all because you have "hand - eye" coordination. Hand - eye coordination is perhaps one of the most necessary aspects of life that a person can have. Face it, everybody needs it! So why not help your body to get that talent: buy a computer. Imagine, our society would advance in its sports and even just with life if they learn how to coordinate themselves. Did you know that 8 out of 10 people who owned a computer and typed daily were able to catch all three tennis - balls that were thrown at them! You could do that too! When typing on a computer, human development observers state that your eyes are freely tracked on the screen and you train your hands to maneuver about the keys all by themselves. Just as in basketball, when you train your hand to track the bounce of the ball without you needing to consciously catch it. I can remember when I started typing, my hands began to naturally find the keys without me having to look at them. And the next day at basketball practice I felt like legendary point - guard Magic Johnson, the ball just came straight to my hand! Get this need of life, invest in a computer! Money might be the most vital thing in our society right now. With profits as low as medium wage, our local area is not that "rich." I can see how it could be hard, having to purchase these computers at prices as high as $2000 each. But then just think, each book that we won't have to purchase would save us $50 each. Not only do computers stand to last 5 times longer than any paperback, their information is always new, changing, and up - to - date. In order for us to be purchasing new books because of recent information would end up costing more in the long - run. Our neighboring society of Newtown just invested in over 100 computers for their society. They stated that it took only 6 months to get the money back that they had spent on the computers with the amount they saved by not purchasing books! Now just imagine how much money our society would gain after 1 year! It is necessary for our society to have computers. With them, we not only learn hand - eye coordination but we also invest in more money - saving opportunities. And now with so many things happening in the world, it is important to receive information instantaneously from these computers. I can't stress enough that without them, we would be left behind. Dreams of incredible rockets, medicines, and cures for diseases just won't happen without the aid of computers. Computers are perhaps the only thing that can truly benefit our society in the long run. You must understand how important this technology is to our society! But, in the long - run, the decision is yours to make. Choose quickly, the fate of our society is in your hands.

Dear Newspaper: I believe that computers are good for our society. There are many reasons as to why I hold this belief. One reason is that it makes life easier. Tech Innovators Society, Technology has developed significantly in the past few decades. My opinion about the effects of computers is that computers do help you, but people should not use the computer too much. People should exercise, interact with family, and enjoy nature. Interacting with family is more important than using a computer because family support is crucial. Friends you make online may not be as reliable as your family. My opinion is that computers should only be used to check your mail or to learn something you want to find out. In conclusion, while computers are useful tools, we should not let them replace the important aspects of real - life experiences like exercise, family interaction, and enjoying nature.

To use computers, or not to. That is the question. Hundreds of millions of people use computers in their daily life today, but some believe that using computers does not benefit society. It is my firm belief that they do. Computers provide entertainment, a way to interact with people, and a nearly endless expanse of knowledge. Without them, we would quickly find life to be much harder and less fun to navigate. Have you ever been in your house on a rainy day just sitting around bored because there is nothing on TV? Well, I have on many occasions. When that happens, all you have to do is turn on the computer and you have endless choices at your fingertips. You can go on game sites and play thousands of different games. (This can also help improve your hand - eye coordination.) You can also watch movies or TV shows that you missed or want to watch again. You can even go on sites such as fanfiction.net, and read or write your own stories! Another reason why computers benefit society is that they help you interact with people. You can keep in touch with far - away family members and friends using webcams, email, and chat sites without the bill that would come with talking on the phone. You can also meet new people from different countries and become their friends. That way you learn about different ways of life and cultures. You can also quickly contact people in an emergency, get updates on events, and communicate with your teacher if you have a question about your homework. Lastly, and maybe even most importantly, computers are an enormous source of knowledge. Say you wanted to learn how to start a campfire, you could just search, "how to make fire" on Google and countless matches would be found in seconds. Also, if you were assigned a project for school, you could do all of your research easily from your computer, then type the whole thing up on a word document. You can even get a college degree online if you wished. And if you want to find a restaurant that specializes in Italian cooking, you can find one close to you, get directions to it, look at the menu, see the prices, get the restaurant's history, and find reviews for it all on one magnificent little device: your computer. So you see, computers benefit society greatly. In fact, I don't think we could live without them. They provide us with entertainment, an easy way to interact with people, and a huge source of information. Now, to all of you people who still think computers are bad; I'd like to see you last a week without using one. It's clear that computers have become an indispensable part of our lives, enhancing our daily experiences in numerous ways.

Dear editor, I hear you are looking for your citizens' opinion on whether computers are bad or good. My opinion is that computers are bad. The good thing is that you can get these chores done while enjoying the fresh air outside instead of being stuck inside on the computer.   My next reason why I think computers are bad is that people spend all their time working on the computer and have no time for exercise. Exercise is a very fun and important thing to do. You feel great when you go outside, hang out with friends, and get some physical activity. Exercise is a main way of staying healthy. So, exercise is a crucial part of staying healthy. There are many ways to exercise, like biking, running, walking, rowing, climbing a mountain, etc. The possibilities are endless. "Same here, same here." You never know who you can meet in the park. I wouldn't have met my friend if I was inside on the computer. Since I come to the park every day, I might meet a new friend every day.   My last reason why I think the computer is bad is that you don't get enough interacting time with friends and family. I love my family, but if I'm on the computer all the time, I can't interact with them properly. If they are out exercising and I'm here on the computer, I miss out on those precious moments. In conclusion, I think the computers are bad because you can't get enough time for exercising, enjoying nature, and spending quality time with family and friends.

Dear officials, as a student of the local middle school, I've noticed that technology is utilized to the fullest. Firstly, computers hinder interpersonal connections. Although social media helps keep in touch with old college buddies, no computer can replace face - to - face communication. From hard, cold text on a screen, one cannot decipher subtle connotations or the wit in a conversation. Moreover, people are beginning to replace in - person meetings with online networking.   With the technological revolution, games like World of Warcraft emerged. These games are extremely addicting. Although our society mocks "nerds" for spending too much time playing these trivial games, it really is a serious issue. For example, in a recent study done by Harvard University students, "7 out of 10 teenagers who play computer games do not get the recommended amount of daily exercise." This is because these games are so absorbing. The amount of time put into gaming ultimately consumes all free time. This is dangerous because a gaming addiction can lead to delusion, social inadequacy, and obesity.   As a people, we are quickly learning that what was once considered so genius is actually dangerous. If one was to stare at a backlit screen for hours on end, their eyesight would definitely start to deteriorate. Loss of eyesight is just one of the negative impacts computers have on our health. As aforementioned, obesity is also a major issue. Now, couple this with bad eyesight, vitamin D deficiency, and a negative outlook, and you've got yourself a serious problem. In conclusion, computers, despite their initial appeal, have a significant negative influence on people and their health, and we should take steps to limit our usage.

With the computer came a plague of not exercising and a disinterest in, perhaps even an inability to enjoy nature. On top of this destruction of the mind, this "monster" is the cruel cause of many declining relationships. After all, who has time for friends and family while in the middle of an internet game? As unique and intriguing as the computer might be, it is slowly destroying the mind. Increasing interest in a monitor tends to result in decreasing care for exercise as well as a decline in the amount of exercise gotten each day. While playing on the computer, the mind @MONTH1 might be racing but the body sits unmoving, with little to no @CAPS1 physical activity being done. Indeed, for some, the addiction is so awful that the person only moves to get food, use a restroom, go to bed or when a parent demands it. All of the day's food settles into the stomach and little to none of it is burned off. Meanwhile, in some of the more severe cases, the person is so entranced that bedtimes are pushed later. Sleep is essential to the body and mind and going without can be damaging. Nowadays, the computer detracts from the sleep and exercise that the body requires. Even nature suffered from the advent of computers. Fewer people went out to admire its beauty. Nature is a wonderful teacher about the circle of life and the natural way of the world. Oftentimes, parallels can be drawn between the wild and the tamed. Attached as people are to computers, they cannot experience the world to the fullest. Some argue that flora and fauna can be found online, but seeing a picture is different, almost cheating, compared to being beside the plant, able to study it from all angles rather than in an unmoving form. The experience is not the same. Also, computers are usually indoors, so the true world is shielded from view. Even nowadays with laptops, if one was to be brought outside, the user would be focusing on the screen, not what is around them. Computers have severely cut down on the admiration of nature. Even family and friends suffer when computers are around. Many people barely pay attention to conversation while focusing on the screen. They tend to only pretend to listen half the time. Even when chatting with friends online, the conversation is disjointed because attention is probably focused on another part of the internet. Frequently, during conversations without a computer nearby, the mind is focused on something from earlier that day. In conclusion, computers have had a detrimental impact on our physical health, our appreciation of nature, and our relationships. We should be more aware of these negative effects and try to find a balance.

Now I regret not getting together with her to hang out more often. Also, many arguments now have something to do with a misunderstanding through the computer. The truth is, computers are starting to have a negative effect on our society and even ruin relationships. If we just get off our computers and get out, we can turn that around and bring back the warmth of real - life interactions.

Dear Local Newspaper: Are computers positively affecting society? As technology advances, humans are relying on them more and more; most people use them daily. Whether it is writing a resume, a science report, or a spreadsheet, none of these are ever seen nowadays done by hand. Everyone expects to see the flawlessly inked letters on the printer paper in whatever piece of writing it is. This helps the people writing the paper because writing takes many drafts to get the piece perfect; it is a pain to write each draft by hand. My second reason why computers positively effect people is by being a social tool. Many websites online these days have social networks such as YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, and MySpace. The nice thing about meeting them online is that you don't have to plan a time to meet the person. When you are both online, you guys can begin chatting. Online sites like eHarmony or Match.com take people with little time to worry about love and match them with their perfect mate. This also helps people who are shy get married and start a family. This helps people live happier lives, another positive effect. Finally, computers positively effect people by making research much easier. My dad always says "You kids got it easy. When I was growing up, we'd have to go to the library and spend hours researching before we could write our papers." Nowadays, it's simple. Using the internet and a search engine, all you have to do is type a topic and you can get all the latest articles in just seconds. Libraries might not have the most recent books, or someone might've checked out your topic's book. Then what can you do? The internet is also an extremely useful help when the research topic is very specific, if it's a certain bacteria or species that a book might only briefly mention. The internet has a much broader range of articles, so it is much easier to find information for any topic. With research taking less time to understand, people can spend more time enjoying the day, like playing outside, than in the library stressing because they cannot find a book on their topic. This is a strong reason why computers should not be seen as a negative effect on society. To conclude, computers have a positive effect on society because they help write papers, they are a social tool, and are a big help with research. Where would we be if we had to handwrite everything? Think about how many fewer friends or maybe even relationships we would have without social websites. What about how hours of research are now just two clicks away? Computers have changed our lives for the better, and we should whole - heartedly appreciate all they do for us.

Dear Newspaper, @CAPS1 technology has grown exponentially during the last few years. The use of computers, especially, has sky-rocketed. However, I believe this is not something to be excited about. The constant use of computers can affect people's health, relationships with family and friends, and their appreciation of nature. The over - usage of computers is a huge problem. Have you ever sat in front of a computer screen for hours on end? If so, you know the feeling of sleepiness and irritability. The lack of physical activity while using a computer impacts people more than they realize. Excessive use of computers has been linked to obesity and high blood pressure. As people spend more time on the computer, their blood pressure tends to rise. Just sitting in front of a screen is extremely harmful to people's bodies. To stay healthy, one should only use the computer when it's absolutely necessary. Spending too much time on the computer can isolate people from others. In this generation, adolescents especially, use the computer to communicate with others more than having face - to - face conversations. Communicating only over the computer can lead to social isolation. Not to mention how quickly rumors and secrets spread over the internet. Using the computer can ruin relationships, even those within a family. Neglecting family by being constantly on the computer can drive people apart. Families can seem less important. People can't focus on their families while being engrossed in a computer screen. Computers are creating false substitutes for almost everything, even nature. Humans originally lived in the wild, gathering food from the land and replanting. Our connection with nature was strong as we needed it to survive. Nowadays, instead of listening to the sound of rain and the rustling of dry leaves, people prefer the high - pitched artificial beeping and the classic "You've got mail." People no longer appreciate nature as they used to. The beauty of nature is simply overlooked as if it's nothing special. Well, without nature, we wouldn't be alive. Life cannot exist without something to thrive on. We can either hop on our computers and look at pictures of nature on @ORGANIZATION1.com, or we can put on our shoes and experience it firsthand. No one can truly experience the greatness of nature while on the computer. No one can feel the cool lake water sliding over their skin or the warmth of a hot @DATE1 day while emailing a friend. It's impossible. Computers have robbed us of our ability to fully experience life. In conclusion, computers are harmful to people. They can affect health, relationships with friends and family, and appreciation of nature. We must use computers only when necessary in order to stay healthy. Instead of going online, go outside and embrace the real world.
