Subsequently, the young teen or kid never returns. It's a terrifying reality that lurks on the internet. Another reason is that the computer makes you stupid. For example, when I used to be on the computer all day, I would get up to get something to eat. Sometimes, I would absent - mindedly go into the bathroom thinking it was the kitchen. It felt like I was in a daze when I finally got off the computer, as if I had just woken up from a long slumber. My last reason is that the computer makes you lazy. You just sit in front of the computer all the time, on the chair, without getting any sunlight or exercise. The allure of @CAPS1 makes you want to stay there even more, and it's not good for your mind or body. These are my three compelling reasons why you should not stay on the computer for extended periods. The more time you spend on it, the more you'll be inclined to stay. So, don't stay on the computer because there are bad things on it, and @CAPS1 will make you lazy. Please limit your computer time for the sake of your well - being.

Dear local newspaper, I think that using a computer can have both beneficial and negative impacts on people. The benefits could include gaining knowledge and meeting new people, while the bad effects could be weight gain and a lack of social skills when it comes to talking with friends over the phone or in person. First of all, gaining knowledge through the computer is truly essential. I think this because when your computer crashes or breaks down, having prior knowledge about computers means you would most likely know what to do to fix it. You wouldn't want to have to spend money on anti - software that probably doesn't work effectively. Another reason why using the computer for knowledge - gain is good is that if you aspire to become a computer engineer, all the time you've spent on the computer could really pay off later in life. It would give you a head - start in understanding the field. Secondly, computers can help you meet new people from foreign countries and other states. You don't necessarily have to meet them in person; you can just have a friendly conversation online. This broadens your social circle and exposes you to different cultures and perspectives. The third and last reason why sometimes computers can be bad for you is weight gain. Most people spend so much time on the computer that they don't get enough physical activity. All they do is sit down, munch on unhealthy snacks, and play games or watch videos. This sedentary lifestyle is really bad for your health. In conclusion, using a computer moderately is far better than using it excessively. It can help you gain knowledge, meet new people, but it can also make you gain weight and lead to a lack of social skills. So, it's important to strike a balance in your computer usage.

Dear editor, @CAPS1, while you might think that people spending a lot of time on the computer is good, I strongly disagree. People should get more exercise. Also, they don't get enough fresh air. Finally, they don't spend enough time with family and friends. Now, we have to determine whether people should spend a large amount of time on the computers. Those people who spend a great deal of time on the computer could be going outside every day to get exercise. Some parents have unfortunately got their kids hooked on playing on the computer all day instead of going outside to get exercise. There are so many outdoor activities they could engage in. They could ride bikes through the neighborhood, zip around on scooters, play basketball at the local court, or have a game of wiffle ball in the backyard. They can also go swimming at the local pool, participate in various sports teams, or go to a playground to have fun. Finally, they could take a long, leisurely walk on the beach, enjoying the sand between their toes and the sound of the waves. People need to get fresh air instead of being cooped up on the computer all day. They can go sit on the beach for a while, soak up the sun, and listen to the ocean. They can go outside to watch their kids play or attend their games like baseball or basketball. They can also go outside just to enjoy the beauty of nature. They can sit on their porch to wait for their kids to get off the bus from school. Those people who love to play on the computer don't spend enough quality time with their family or friends. They could visit their family more often, perhaps take a weekend trip to see relatives. They can go out for lunch with their friends, catch up on each other's lives in person. Also, they can spend more time doing things with their kids, like going to the park or having a movie night at home. Even though there is a chat function on the computer, it's always nicer to talk to your friends face - to - face. The time has come to decide whether people spending a lot of time on the computer is a bad thing or not. They don't get enough exercise every day, which can lead to various health problems. They also don't get enough fresh air, which is essential for good health. Finally, they don't spend sufficient time with their friends and family, which can strain relationships. So now, you need to write a letter to your local newspaper, clearly stating which side you're on in this important debate.

Along with the internet, there are programs such as @ORGANIZATION4, and @ORGANIZATION3, which help people to learn a new language, or write more effectively on the computer. Also, computers keep us updated with events that are happening in the world. For example, when the earthquake devastated @LOCATION1, I first saw it on the news, but got very few details. Another reason as to why computers are so helpful to society is that they are tools that help us to keep in touch with others. With things like Facebook and @CAPS2, I can chat with people, invite friends over, and even plan parties. This gives me more time to do things like play outside and exercise. Also, things like @CAPS3 and Facebook help people to stay in touch with old and distant friends. Studies done by @ORGANIZATION5 show that 70% of people with some type of social networking account have a more active social life than those who do not. According to doctor @PERSON1, this means that these people will have an easier time adapting to different social situations than those who do not. Clearly, this is a great benefit. In conclusion, the computer helps society a great deal more than it hinders it. It easily allows people to stay educated, updated, and connected. It makes things that would otherwise take lots of time very quick, giving people the chance to do other things such as playing outside. He wastes these excellent educational opportunities while there are people in under - developed countries like Somalia who are lucky to own a book. I know more than 70% of the kids in my class do not read anything except the required reading, and that is because they sit around on the computers wasting their time. The literacy rate in our area is about 80% and that number is decreasing because of the lack of reading done and the time spent on computers. I have seen a survey that says 4 out of 5 teenagers spend more than 4 hours a day on computers.  These statistics and quotes have left me thinking, how much time do we really need to spend on computers instead of reading? Or else we will turn into oversized monkeys who can't even read. The computers and the internet are doing more than just erasing brain cells and harming our health; they are taking away the experiences that we could have outside in nature. Nature holds natural wonders like the Grand Canyon, the Rocky Mountains, and the Great Barrier Reef. What beats skiing down a large slope, or climbing Mount Everest? Certainly not computers.  Unfortunately, that's what most teenagers choose to do. They sit and tap on the keyboard instead of walking nature trails and walking on the beaches. They sit on old moldy chairs and stare at computer screens, unlike the people enjoying the butterfly gardens and wildlife preserves. Instead of taking steps to help the environment, we are sitting on the computers, sleeping and being mesmerized by the light of the screen. We should be preserving and learning about what is left on the planet, but we are not because of these computers and the internet.  I have presented a strong argument against computers that you may listen to or not. I strongly urge you to take action to start reducing the time spent on computers. Set up programs at your house or town for turning off the computers. We need to do something now!

Dear editor, last week, I noticed an article in the paper headlined "Get off the computer and go exercise." This caught me off - guard because there are many benefits to computers. For instance, it enhances education in multiple ways. You can learn about foreign countries, their unique cultures, traditions, and histories. You can also talk to other people from different parts of the world.  Every school has a computer, and they are easily accessible and very helpful. I know that last year, if someone asked a question and the teacher wasn't sure of it, we would go straight to the computer. It also helps us do better on projects. I know I had to do a project last month, and without the computer, I wouldn't have completed it successfully.  We also use the computers for the programs they have. In art class, we made a cartoon and made it look real with Photoshop. It's also easy and fast to use a computer for research. You can search for information on various topics, from science experiments to historical events. You can also learn about far - away places with a computer. For example, you can find out about other countries in the world. You could find out if it were landlocked or not, how many people live there, and facts similar to those. You can also learn the history about the country such as their leaders and government. Finally, you can also learn up - to - the - minute facts with websites like BBC.com.  Lastly, you can talk with other people using email, instant messaging, and websites like Facebook, which allows you to connect with friends. With email, you can talk with someone for business purposes, receive links to useful websites, and share information. Instant messaging is just like texting on your phone, except much faster. You can instantly talk to people and catch up with them. Thousands of people are on Facebook. You can connect with old friends, and talk to current ones. I know my mom uses Facebook and talks to old friends since she moved.  So, in my opinion, I think computers are a good thing to have. Not only do they enhance your education, but they also teach us foreign countries' history and let us connect to old friends. When you were in school, do you remember your "best - friend - for - life?" Well, with Facebook, you can catch up with them, instead of them being just a memory.

Dear Board of Education of the local school district, did you know that eight out of ten homes in our town have at least one computer if not more? Computers help us with daily things and make many tasks, like writing an essay, much easier. They benefit our society in many ways. Without computers, some families would lose contact with loved ones who are far away. Not to mention, they can keep many things very organized and neat easily. Maybe the best benefit is how you can learn about far - away countries and cultures with the click of a button. Computers have endless possibilities to how they can benefit our society.  Many people don't realize that some families can not be with each other as easily as others. If a family member is in the military, sometimes talking on the computer is the only chance they get to communicate with their loved ones back home. Saying that this is not a benefit is a lie. For others who don't have such a severe need of communicating, it is still a convenient way to have a conversation with someone far away without racking up the phone bill for a long - distance call. Also, many times this can be an alternative to parents buying their children expensive cell phones. So having a computer is definitely a benefit to communicating.  The computer can also make many tasks much easier. For example, if you were assigned a 10 - page essay in school, typing it on the computer would be much neater and quicker than writing it all out. Also, many businesses rely on computers to keep data organized and all in place. Like the program Excel, Microsoft created this to make a simple way to organize data. It is much more efficient than having everything in different files with millions of text entries in every drawer. So another benefit of the computer is that it can keep things organized and provide easy ways to complete everyday tasks.  Maybe the greatest benefit of the computer is how much you can learn so easily. Say I was curious about the recent earthquake in Japan. If I wanted more information, I'd head straight to the computer. You simply go to Google or another search engine of your choice, type in the subject, one click, and bam, you could read for hours all of the websites and articles that would come up. The computer is full of information, and is right at our fingertips. This is definitely a huge benefit to our society.  The computer is a wonderful tool that can assist in so many ways, whether it is communication, organization, or just satisfying curiosity. This advance in technology is just another way to improve everyday life. Computers don't just benefit our little town, they benefit our whole society in all of the amazing things they do.

Computers are good and bad. Computers are good because they are a great way we can communicate with other people in different states. Through email, video calls, and social media platforms, we can stay in touch with friends and family who are far away. Another reason computers are good is that they can keep you out of trouble and can keep you entertained. There are countless games, movies, and shows available on the computer for entertainment purposes.  On the other hand, computers are bad because some people can become computer freaks and hyper - focused on computers. They may neglect their studies, work, and social lives. They might spend all their time in front of the computer screen, ignoring real - life interactions.  In conclusion, computers have their advantages and disadvantages. They are useful for communication and entertainment, but we need to use them in a balanced way. We should not let them take over our lives and prevent us from engaging in real - world activities. By being aware of the potential negative impacts and using computers responsibly, we can make the most of their benefits.

This can be very helpful for someone's job. In conclusion, computers can teach us hand - eye coordination, can teach us about faraway places and people, and let us interact and share with friends. Computers are a very important part of my life, and their benefits are truly invaluable.

Sure, you could read a newspaper, but answer me this: where does the paper come from? Yup, trees are cut down for them. Computers are the easy, environment - friendly alternative for you. It wasn't phones... no, not television... oh yes, computers! I see why you might think kids should be outside, well let me tell you, cellphones and TV will keep them from that anyway. Out of the billions of people on Earth, only a few hundred thousand are actively involved in environmental protection. It's a great shame to watch nature decline while we remain idle. They bring joy, laughter, and support into your life. If you immerse yourself too deeply in the computer world, your family may feel neglected and could distance themselves from you. Your friends are also vital as they share good times with you and lift your spirits when you're down. Remember, they may not always be around. In conclusion, these are my three reasons for being against excessive computer use. Spending less time exercising, enjoying nature, and with loved ones are all serious concerns, so we should use computers more moderately.

Dear editor, I believe that computers are a great and fun tool. They offer a wide range of capabilities that can enhance our lives. But I also believe people can spend too much time on them. The computer is excellent. People can use them to type papers or detailed reports, make accurate graphs, and perform other important tasks for us. Schools are using computers more and more now. Schools have well - designed websites for students to go to find out their homework, classwork, challenging projects, in - depth reports, and extra - credit opportunities. The school has even started doing something very new, allowing parents and kids to conveniently check the students' grades online. Not only do the schools help students, but also everyday people can benefit as well. If a student has a project but doesn't know how to start it, then he or she can quickly google their project and find various ways to start it. Computers can be really great and easy to use as you can see, especially for schoolwork. Computers are not only great for academic purposes, but also for leisure purposes. Before computers and the internet, there were only these limited ways to have fun during boring times in the day. One was watching TV, reading a book, or going outside, if you could. What do I mean by that last sentence? If you lived in a city, then it would be harder to go outside because maybe you lived in an apartment or somewhere not in a friendly community. Then you couldn't go out; and reading books can become boring after a while, and maybe there was nothing interesting on TV for you to watch. But when computers and the internet came out, people could play exciting games, watch entertaining videos, and talk to cousins or family who live far away. Computers are also good for social networks. Not all families live close, but they are a close - knit family. But in this economy, we can't always afford to visit them whenever we want. So by using computers, we can message them on Facebook, connect with them on MySpace, and even have video chats with them, which, as I said, is great for far - away family. But at times, people can become too obsessed with them. Some people spend all day on one website, particularly Facebook or YouTube. Do not get me wrong, these websites are fun and cool. But not cool enough to prevent us from going outside and having free, natural fun. I remember I logged into Facebook and saw a girl on. I logged off around an hour later and she was still on. Then I logged in again around 3 p.m. and the same girl was on! That is just too long to be on one website. Computers are a great tool for humans to use for business, education, and leisure. But too much use is not good. We should strike a balance between using computers and engaging in other activities.

Do you like computers? Do you use the internet to help you with your studies, work, or daily life? Do you use it every day? Well, if not, this article gives you information about all of this. First, a lot of people don't like computers because they say they're too confusing. Actually, computers aren't that hard to work with. You just have to be patient and take some time to get used to their functions. Also, computers can make things easier, like typing. Why should you write by hand when you have the option to use a computer which lets you write faster than you could on normal paper? Secondly, the internet is much easier than books. Finally, you can purchase anything with a click of a button. Almost every website has discounts. I remember the time when I bought $50 shoes for $30 online. I don't think so because it is that helpful and easy to work with. In conclusion, the computer and the internet offer numerous benefits, and with proper usage, they can greatly enhance our lives.

Dear newspaper company, More and more people use computers each day. But not everyone agrees that it benefits society. Some people say that the people who are on computers don't get enough exercise or play outside. Then when they get off the computer, their eyes hurt and they can't see as well. But with all that said, I agree that the benefits of computers, when well - used, are significant. The reasons why I agree that computers have benefits are that they give you hand - eye coordination and provide people with information on far - away places. They can also be used to rent hotels, movies, and games. You can even talk to people online from around the world! What if we didn't have computers though? Then, if a serious crime happened, we wouldn't be able to quickly find the criminal's name or his records! Some bad reasons for having computers are big issues, right? One is cyberbullying! Kids might get picked on, and they will feel bad. People get called names all the time online. Another big problem is that some people seem friendly online, but then they try to deceive others. There are two big problems with computers called plagiarism. Plagiarism is when you take someone else's work and put your name on it. It can also be when you steal an idea and say it's yours. The second problem is stealing music by getting it for free. By downloading from the internet like from LimeWire, then the artists don't get the money from the albums. That is why I agree that computers give you benefits, but they also give you bad ones. So be careful when you're on a computer. In summary, while computers bring many advantages, we need to be vigilant about the associated problems to make the most of this technology.

In conclusion, we should limit our computer time and make more time for nature, family, and friends to lead a more balanced and fulfilling life.

So, you could literally die or get hurt because of your computer. That's why email is the absolute safest way to chat online if you were to have a computer. These are the main reasons why computers are not beneficial to the society. Also, you often don't spend enough time with family or friends, you can become obese because you don't have "time" to exercise, and you can be kidnapped by someone you don't even know through Facebook or MySpace. How would you like it if you had no time with your family, you were obese, and you got kidnapped because you met up with someone who seemed nice through Facebook or even MySpace? In conclusion, the supposed benefits of computers are overshadowed by these significant drawbacks, and we should be more cautious about our computer usage.

I support the advance in technology, especially in computers. Using the computer can effectively teach hand - eye coordination. When you're using a computer, whether it's playing a simple game or doing precise graphic design work, your eyes watch the screen while your hands operate the mouse or keyboard. This constant interaction between the eyes and hands hones the hand - eye coordination skill. It also gives you the ability to learn about faraway places or people. With just a few clicks, you can explore the unique cultures of remote tribes in the Amazon rainforest or the historical architecture of ancient cities in Europe. Moreover, it gives you the opportunity to talk online with other people. Hand - eye coordination is a very important skill to have. It quickens reflexes during everyday life. Hand - eye coordination is needed especially for sports like baseball, where you need to accurately time your swing based on the incoming ball; football, when you're catching a pass; or basketball, while shooting a free - throw. Without computers, many people would lack hand - eye coordination. If you are driving a car on the highway, and suddenly a car swerves onto the wrong side of the road and is heading toward you, you need to react fast. Without proper hand - eye coordination, you could die. Using computers could possibly save your life one day. If somebody wants to go to a foreign country but doesn't know anything about it, they could look it up on the internet. The internet is a major part of having computers. Without it, people probably wouldn't be able to research a country with ease or learn about other people. Some people think that using the computer too much restricts people from getting exercise, which is true in some cases. But the computer is very useful to have if you want to know about something. Like who won the election, or who won the sports championship. The computer is almost a necessity in every home. The computer gives people the opportunity to chat online with other people. Some they know in real life, or some they met online. It expands people's interactive life, helping them make new friends. Though this is a great thing to have access to, it is still important to socialize with people in person, rather than socializing online. Some people have trouble talking to people in person and are more comfortable chatting over the computer. Maybe this person could make a friend and one day meet them in real life. This can be dangerous for younger people, so be careful. I support the advancement in computer technology because it gives people greater reflexes, gives people the opportunity to research faraway places, and gives people access to the internet to chat with people online. These are three huge advantages that using computers give people.

In modern society, it is rare that you come across someone who doesn't know how to basically operate a computer. At one point or another in life, we are all older and want to reconnect with our old friends. Thanks to computers, the process of reconnecting is much easier. Email messages send instantly to anywhere. (And while you're at it, ask for a phone number!) It's always great to talk with old friends. Computers have helped the United States make that easier. Nowadays, computers have been made green in the battle for the environment. Paper is saved with online encyclopedias, newspapers, journals, etc. Not only that but computers are needing less and less electricity. You save money and are helping the environment! Today's society is helping mother nature not only in our actions, but in computers too. In my opinion, computers are helping the United States, not hurting it. Dear Local Newspaper, I have heard that some people do not agree that computers benefit our society. Well, in this letter, I am going to give you three reasons how computers do benefit our society. Those reasons are: People have friends and family in other states; some people use them to stay organized; and computers help you learn more. I hope that by the end of this letter, you will see that computers do benefit our society.  First of all, I think that computers benefit our society because the internet lets people stay in contact with family and friends in other states. It's true that you could use the phone and call them, but you have to pay for long - distance. You don't have to pay anything to email somebody. I know from experience because I have friends and family in a lot of states in the United States. "Computers help me stay in contact with my family all over," says John (Tech Enthusiast). Many people use the computer to contact their loved ones every day. Some people even use them to stay in touch with family members at war.  Next, I believe that computers benefit society because they keep people organized. I know this may not seem like a big deal, but a lot of people use computers to keep things organized so they know how everything is. What would happen if we didn't have computers to manage all of the appointments? Well, I will tell you what would happen. All the appointments would get messed up, and you might end up getting things you already got. "I rely on my computers," says Sarah.  And, I strongly believe that computers benefit our society because they help people learn more. Yes, it's right that not everybody goes on the computers to learn, but that doesn't mean they don't learn. Here are a couple of examples: YouTube - it lets you learn song lyrics, dance moves and more; Twitter - it lets you learn what other people like, don't like and so on. Then there is Facebook, which lets you see what people are doing that day. "People learn everything from the computer," says Mark.  Now, if you still think that computers don't benefit our society, that is your opinion. I hope you see what I see now and recognize the many ways computers are a boon to our society.

While you're reading this, I hope you understand why it's wrong to overuse the computer and take my suggestion seriously. Most of all, won't you miss your friends? At this age, kids/teens should be partying with friends and not gossiping online. Lastly, my final reason is the simplest; enjoy nature and explore the outside instead of living on the inside. It's good to go out once in a while and get a breath of fresh air. If you haven't visited the park in a while, it would be great. Hear all the birds chirping and see the trees and flowers bloom! Then take a nice walk or stroll in the park. You're getting exercise and exploring nature too. While you're at it, plant some flowers in your garden. This shows that instead of buying games online, you're buying seeds to help the environment. In conclusion, spending time on the computer is not bad, just don't spend hours - upon - hours on it. Kids will be kids, as well, adults will be adults. So take these considerations to heart. Try to get exercise, hang out with your friends and family, and enjoy nature!

Dear Newspaper Editor, It has come to my attention that the aspect of computers and their influence on people has been brought up. I personally feel that computers are a marvelous tool to help mankind advance. They provide infinite knowledge, entertainment, and despite what the opposing side says, allow social interactions for those who don't like to meet face - to - face. My first reason why computers benefit humans rather than hurt them is the knowledge they provide. Computers give access to the internet, which has a near - infinite amount of knowledge stored inside it. With a simple click of a button, you have thousands of websites dedicated to answering your question. They can provide tons of information normally unobtainable. Take for example two students, one with a computer and one without. Both are given an assignment to write a report on a famous person. The one with the computer logs on, searches for the person, and in seconds has enough information to write numerous reports. He aces the report, and continues to use this method. He graduates top of the class, goes through college and gets a high - paying job right out of the gate. The one without the computer needs to go to the library. After spending an hour walking there, he learns that all the books on that person are checked out. He finds a book with a short bit on that person and writes about it. He fails the test, fails the grade, drops out of school, and works at a fast - food joint his entire life. See how much of a difference a computer can make? My second reason is that, even though computers are often thought of as destroying social lives, they can actually build social lives. Millions of people use the internet every day, and there are places on the web built so that they can talk. Some people worry that this is dangerous and leads to privacy issues, but anyone who has basic knowledge knows not to share personal information. The internet also has social media platforms, and those still unsure can use specially designed sites to talk to people they know in real life only. The internet also allows for people to ask questions. Having difficulty finding specific information? Just post a question on a public site, and people with first - hand experience will answer it with all the detail you need and more. Say that somebody wants to be a writer, but needs to know how the writing system works, how to set up a job in writing, what the pay is, etc. He searches the internet, but only finds job applications and college ads, so he asks the questions on a public site. Someone who has been a writer their whole life checks out the question and answers it in great detail. Problem solved, and he has connected with someone on the internet. My final reason is the entertainment computers provide. You can play games, watch movies or homemade videos, and even talk to friends. Computers allow you to access thousands of free services to benefit you. Sitting in your room, bored? Why not play a game on your computer. Tired of watching the same old movies? Go to the computer and have an infinite video library at your disposal. Lonely? Go to a social website and strike up a conversation. The internet has infinite entertainment, right at your finger - tips. In conclusion, I believe that there is no limit to what you can do with a computer, as long as you have the imagination. Computers were invented to benefit mankind, not to hurt it, and they are doing a great job.

Do you like learning about far - away exotic lands and the diverse animals that inhabit them? Are you good at sports but would like to enhance your skills even more? Do you ever long for your family members who live in other states? The computer can assist you with all of these aspects, but is it bad for you too? In my opinion, kids and adults should use the computer. When people are on the computer, they can explore and learn about interesting far - away lands. When you're on the computer, you can look up some of the natural disasters. For example, people could google earthquakes and learn all about the people who have lost their lives. Then, they might donate some money to the poor, especially children living on their own. They can also learn about all the wonderful, beautiful lands that are out there waiting to be explored. Everyone I know likes to see the beautiful birds and animals in the world. They will be able to do this on the computer. There might be even more of these lands to discover. Having a computer will also let you talk to people who are not easily reachable. With a computer, people will be able to talk to their family that lives in other states. I have an uncle that lives in @LOCATION1. I only get to see him because it costs a lot of money for him to come. Somewhere on the computer, it is easy to just send him a message that says how I'm doing. With a computer, you will be able to talk to your friends when you can't talk on the phone. For example, what if your friend can't talk on the phone? What do you do? The computer can help you communicate with her. The last reason why we should have a computer is that if you use it for @MONTH1 periods of time, it will help you with hand - eye coordination. This will help the kids that play baseball. They will know where the ball is at all times, and they will most likely catch the ball more often. So, playing a little bit of video games is not bad for you unless you overdo it. Using the computer is indeed a good thing, and not using the computer prevents people from interacting with those who are not easy to talk to in person. So, if you are completely against using the computer, get up and use it right now. Computers offer so many benefits that can enrich our lives in various ways.

As more and more technology is being invented, people rely on the computer to do work and to learn. But spending more time on the computer is not necessarily a good thing. People do not exercise enough, strain their eyes, and have less interaction with real people. One reason computers are having a negative affect on people is because they no longer get enough exercise. Take my friend @CAPS1 for example. He was a dedicated triathlete, who trained every single day so he could participate in the @CAPS2 @CAPS3 - @CAPS4 man in @LOCATION1 next @DATE1. But then he got his computer. @CAPS1 had suddenly lost all interest in exercise and spent his whole day checking his e - mail instead of training. But he is not the only person who has become unhealthy because of computers. Experts say that people with computers at home get only @PERCENT1 of the exercise that people without computers get. People with computers also were more likely to be overweight and choose chips over an apple in a study performed at @ORGANIZATION1. @PERSON1, who headed this study said, "People are taught by society that computers can do such wonderful things and educate them. However, they are not taught how bad they can be for your health when used too much." Clearly, computers are a problem to our health. Another reason computers are a problem is because they strain your eyes. When my school had disabled people come and talk to us @DATE1, there was a blind lady named @PERSON5, who lost her sight because she was a workaholic and spent too much time on her laptop. But she is not the only one to lose her vision because of computers. Scientists at the @CAPS7 lab in @LOCATION2 said that @NUM1 out of @NUM2 regular computer users lost their vision within two years. One of these scientists, @PERSON3, reported, "As more people begin to use the computer, more people seriously hurt their eyes or even lose their vision. We estimate @PERCENT2 of this next generation will be legally blind before age @NUM3." Undoubtedly, this new technology is harmful and very damaging to our vision. A third reason people should not use computers is because they stop interacting with real people. My uncle, @PERSON4, lives in @LOCATION3. We used to see each other from time to time and talk on the phone about once a week. That is, until he found out about the chat rooms and virtual worlds on the internet. Now, I haven't seen or talked to him in almost a @DATE1 because he has created a new family on the computer and spends the whole day pretending he is a @CAPS10 and fighting dragons on the internet game @CAPS10 @CAPS11. But he is not the only person with this issue. It is proven that @PERCENT3 of people who go into games like these or chatrooms lose interest in friends and family and their social skills worsen. Professor @PERSON2 had this to say about how this is affecting people. "Too many people are finding out about these sites and getting hooked. They stop caring about school, sports, even their friends. It's alarming!" Given all these reasons, why would you want to use a computer after learning how bad it is for you and your loved ones! Computers will bring nothing but grief to humanity. They are extremely dangerous for our health. They cause us to stop exercising and gain weight, permanently damage our eyes, and deny us of the proper socialization that all people need to be happy and healthy. We should be more cautious about our computer usage to avoid these negative consequences.

Computers are very popular these days. Many people use computers for research, jobs, shopping, homework, and more. Although, some people think computers take up too much of our time and that it prevents society from interacting with friends and family. What's great about computers is that you can chat with your friends and family online or even have a video chat with them. So, you're never really avoiding your friends and family. Another thing that is great about computers is that you can research anything you need to, for projects, jobs, homework, and things for school, etc. The top websites people use for resources are @CAPS1.com, @LOCATION1, etc. These websites offer a vast amount of information that can be accessed quickly. Computers are also great for typing out reports, making power - points for jobs and projects, and so much more! Anything you could think of is most likely found in a computer. As you can see, a computer is so helpful and is a great resource. Having a computer at home is much better than taking a trip down to the public library. You can save time and money from taking all those trips and get your own personal library by getting a computer. You never know what new technology could bring, and computers are constantly evolving to offer even more benefits. In conclusion, computers are an essential part of modern life, and their advantages far outweigh the minor concerns some people may have.

Everyone will agree that using computers is also a good choice because you do get to meet people you don't know. Also, you learn more stuff you don't know. Not only that, but you can also learn more about technology. Most people would say that meeting people is good because you can have fun talking and getting to know people. Also, people would want to learn about other people's cultures. Some people would want to know some personal or business - related things about people. Even people want to know where some people are from. People like to know about the different backgrounds and stories of others. Through computers, you can connect with people from all over the world, which broadens your perspective and enriches your knowledge. In addition, learning about technology can open up new opportunities and keep you updated with the latest trends. So, using computers is a great way to expand your horizons and have meaningful interactions.

Dear @CAPS1's at the @ORGANIZATION1, as @CAPS2 said to @PERSON2, "Computers have helped me further my research. I can search up so many things to help a patient and keep all my important information organized." Can you question a leading doctor? I agree with @PERSON3 and say that computers are of great use in society today. People were already becoming lazy because of television. You can't blame it on computers. With websites such as @CAPS4 and @CAPS5, people can keep in touch. They can make plans with one another to go for a walk in the park or dancing. These things can keep people healthy, active, and in tiptop shape. Computers help people keep in contact with others. "@My patients can email me to schedule an appointment and let me know if they think something's very wrong with them," says @PERSON1. With computers, you can email distant family and friends to learn if there are problems quicker. Most people tend not to pick up the phone if someone calls during a crisis. You also don't have to worry about running up your phone bill. You can just @CAPS4 chat with a bud instead of using up an hour's worth of minutes. You can learn so much more information faster. How would you feel if no one called and told you your best friend died or your mom, and you had to find out by reading the newspaper? You'd be extremely upset. I know I would. With email, you and your family can stay in touch with old, new, and now friends. So if anything bad happens and a person didn't know how to tell you, they could email you. It's so much easier than telling a person that their mom died by phone. To hear pain in a person's voice will make you want to cry. You feel their pain. So, now do you understand that computers are a great benefit to today's society? You can't blame computers for people becoming lazy, since television was already doing that. If a person wants to be lazy, then that's their decision. You shouldn't go around blaming others and things when it's no one else's fault but that person's. This is a great way to keep in contact with others. Plus, think of all the information you can learn. Not just about family and friends, but the world too. Thank you for taking the time to read my essay, and I hope you can see things my way. In today's fast - paced world, computers are indispensable tools that enhance our lives in numerous ways.

One evening, after I got home from school, I was completely at a loss as I didn't know what I had for homework. I decided to call my friend's cell phone. However, instead of reaching her, I got her voicemail. I patiently left her a voicemail and then called her house phone instead, but unfortunately, the same thing happened. Luckily, I had my other friends' numbers I could use. The next day, I asked her why she didn't pick up her cell and house phone. She told me "I'm sorry, I guess I was too busy on the computer e-mailing other people." Whenever I think of people being on the computer too much, I believe they don't get enough exercise, don't enjoy nature, and spend less time with family and friends. First, when people spend too much time on the computer, they naturally spend less time exercising. About a certain percentage of people do this and it's clearly not healthy. If people do this too often, then they will not get enough exercise and without exercise, they won't be healthy as they get older. As @PERSON1 said "If adults spend too much time on the computer, maybe several hours a day or more while eating junk food like chips and soda, they are not setting a good example for their kids. If adults get into this bad habit, so will their kids and it's too early for kids to be unhealthy." I also whole - heartedly agree with @PERSON1; she is right about how people spend too much time on the computer. Second, when people are on their computer, it's as if their face is firmly glued to the screen and they don't care about nature at all. When people do this, I really can't stand it. It's like they don't care about anything else. What I don't get is why can't they go outside and do something for at least a half - hour, then go back to the computer and waste their time then? Going outside and enjoying nature is so peaceful on a nice sunny day. You could have a picnic, take a hike, or even hang out with friends instead of playing on the computer. I understand that if it's a bad day like when it's snowing or there's a thunderstorm and you can't do anything outside, then it's okay to go on the computer. I think that at least a certain percentage of people would try this. Third, if people are too busy on the computer then they won't be able to hang out with friends or family. If your friends want to hang out with you and they want to go to the mall. But you can't because you're on the computer, she would be really furious at you. You picked the computer over your friends to go to the mall. There's probably a certain chance she won't ever talk to you again. And I don't blame her. People who spend too much time on the computer would barely understand what's going on. If someone tells you something, it goes in one ear and out the other. When people do this, it's really disappointing because you don't hang out as much with your friends and family. As you can see, people are spending too much time on the computer rather than exercising, enjoying nature, and spending time with family and friends. If you ask me, I don't play on the computer as much which is definitely a good thing.

Dear, @CAPS1 town. As you know, computers are a part of our lives, but is it a positive or negative influence? Computers can be a great thing. They can show you different parts of the world and breaking news. They can even help you decide on your next vacation. They could also help you talk to family and friends. What would our lives be like without them? Well, our lives without computers could be challenging. However, computers do have negative sides as well. For instance, you have to spend a lot of money on one, and they often need to be fixed. People can use the computer too much and not get enough exercise, which can lead to obesity. Also, you can waste a lot of energy. A bad part about the internet is chat rooms. If you talk to the wrong people, then you can be in trouble. Overall, computers are a key part of our lives. They can help us decide on our next @DATE1 break trip, but they can also contribute to making us fat. We need to be aware of both the positive and negative aspects of computers and use them in a balanced way.

Many people think computers are bad or that we spend less time outside because of them. But are they as bad for individuals to use as people say they are? In this instance, moderation would be helpful. When you think of computers, what comes to mind? Games? Social @CAPS1? What if computers are doing more than that? Last year, a computer helped diagnose a concussion of mine and helped figure out I've had @NUM1 others. Not to mention, the computer did it quicker and more efficiently than a regular human. An expert says "Computers diagnose anything, not just concussions, @PERCENT1 better than doctors." Moreover, the social networking has a positive aspect. This has let people, who haven't seen each other for a long time, reconnect and become good friends again. With the positive aspects, there is always a negative. Computers have started to make kids obese. This is a problem in the country because if we become lazy, then we could ruin our country. In addition, if we become too reliant on computers for diagnoses, what happens when they get faulty? These are problems that are very real and aren't being addressed. If we can't deal with these problems first, then computers will turn out to be a bad thing. Lastly, moderation could be extremely helpful for us today. For example, instead of using social @CAPS1 to communicate with friends next door, go outside and play wiffle ball with them. Dear ABC, Computers have really made an impact on society. Some people think they have made a good impact while others think the opposite. I believe that they are a good thing in our lives and have made a drastic, but great impact. Some reasons that support my opinion are that computers are basically what helps us keep in touch with people, they make it very easy to find needed information, and they make our school lives faster and much simpler. First of all, computers are pretty much how people keep in touch. There are many ways you can keep in touch over computers. There is video - chatting, e - mail, and chat websites such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram etc. There are many people that really enjoy having the ability to keep in touch this way. It is a step up from talking on the phone. On the computer, if you are web - chatting, you can not only talk to them, but you can see them! When it comes to chatting websites such as Facebook, there are millions of people who belong to this incredible website and love it. Kids and adults really enjoy having access to something like this. For me, since I moved to California and had to leave all my friends behind, the computer has saved some of my relationships that I thought I would lose but didn't want to. I can e - mail my friends, and even see what they look like and how much they have changed on Facebook. Computers are a very helpful piece of technology that have helped me, and so many other people keep in touch. Another important reason computers are a wonderful technology item is because they make it so easy to find needed information. From what a word means, to the directions to get to New York City, the computer can help with all of this. I talked to my mom and she said, "Computers just make accessing all of the information I need to know about your brother's diabetes so easy." Accessing information in books can take so long. You have to go to the library or a bookstore, find the book you need with the correct information, and then you have to read through the whole book to find the information needed. On a computer, you can just google what you need to find, and read the article or map, etc. Computers have made accessing information a breeze and everyone loves how simple it is! The last reason that supports my opinion is that computers make our school lives faster and much simpler to deal with. In school, there are times when we need to write a very lengthy composition, and it will take forever to write. With a computer, typing up the composition would probably take around half the time of writing the composition. I took a survey of three kids that typed a composition and three kids that wrote it. I asked each of the kids how long it took them. The kids that wrote the paper said it took them around two hours. The kids that typed the composition said it took them around an hour. Also, when things are typed, they are usually easier to read, which makes it easier for teachers to grade, and won't take as long. Computers make school easier for students and teachers. The opinion that computers are not a benefit to society just doesn't make sense. Yes, I know that there can be some disadvantages. But think of all the advantages compared to the disadvantages. There are a lot more good than bad things. Without computers, people would be incredibly stressed, and have a hard time making life easier. Computers are an amazing benefit to society. Everyone should agree with this because people can stay in touch because of computers, computers make it very easy to find information that is needed, and they make our school lives easier and faster for students and teachers. Computers have made an extremely large impact and changed our ways of life for the better!

Dear local newspaper editor, I'm sure you love having the internet at your fingertips. Well, it got to the point where she stopped playing sports, gained some weight and the sadness crept upon her. She was in a depression mode. She went to the doctors and they told her that she had to give up the computer and use it for only two days a week for five hours only. She listened to the doctor and it took her about three months to get back to the fun Lily she used to be. Being on the computer too much can harm you and the people around you. Second of all, the friends you meet on the internet are called cyber friends. You don't know who they really are, where they really live, or their real age. They can tell you anything they want because they know that the internet is a little fantasy world. That is mentally not healthy. It is very important for human beings to be socially active. Being on the computer too much can harm your brain also, as it reduces real - life social interactions. Third of all, bad incidents might pop up. If you are the type of person who is on the computer every chance you get, like Becky, it is not good for you or the device. Being on the computer for long periods can cause eye strain, back pain and also harm the computer's hardware due to overheating. Well, you've read my arguments and ideas. Please take them into consideration as we should all be more aware of the negative impacts of excessive computer use.

Computers have become increasingly advanced over time. They have also gotten smaller and smaller, yet many people still fail to understand the dangers that computers pose to society and their personal lives, such as stress, addiction, and cyberbullying. I am here to discuss how computers are a nuisance in our lives. First and foremost, computers are one of the leading causes of stress in daily life. Approximately four out of every ten stressed people are stressed because of their computers. For example, imagine you're writing an important document or sending an email to your boss about work, and suddenly your computer crashes. How would you feel? Would you be extremely upset? Would you feel like pulling your hair out and throwing that computer out the window? I'm pretty sure you would, as your data is lost, you'll have to restart your computer, and in the worst - case scenario, take it to an electronic store to get it fixed. Another cause of stress is computer hacking. Hacking has unfortunately @CAPS1 become a worldwide â€œsport.â€ There are books and instructions on how to hack a computer, and the government can't do much about it since the First Amendment gives people the right to publish what they want (freedom of speech and press). Just look at what happened in @LOCATION1. A computer hacker managed to hack into a system and shut off power to an entire city for about @NUM1 days. Moreover, if someone uploads a virus to your computer, they can steal all of your personal information, like your social security number. These two factors can cause major stress in your daily life. Secondly, people spend an excessive amount of time on the computer at home. A recent survey shows that six out of every ten teenagers spend more than two hours on the computer each day. This makes them less social, meaning they won't spend time with friends, family, or even participate in sports. As a result, they won't get the recommended one - hour of exercise a day. In conclusion, the negative impacts of computers, including stress, reduced social interaction, and lack of exercise, are significant. We should be more aware of these issues and find ways to use computers in a more balanced and healthy manner to avoid these detrimental effects on our lives.

Although the computer and internet shouldn't completely replace books, it is a valuable researching tool. Dear @CAPS1, there are several reasons why I believe that advances in technology are harmful to our society. Firstly, it opens doors to strangers in the outside world, especially for teens, adults, and others. The problem is that you never really know who's on the other side of that virtual door. In chat rooms, people can misguide you into thinking they're someone they're not. For example, there's a show called Dateline. This show reveals how young teens put themselves online. Grown or young men click on a picture of a teen, and that opens up a chat line, like opening a door. You have no idea who's on the other side. These men online make these teens trust them and feel safe. Then they might say, "Hey, can I come over sometime?" The young teen, thinking they're a friend, might say yes. Remember, they don't see the man's picture. When he comes over, most of these men have ulterior motives. This is what happens on the Dateline TV show. Just imagine how many other kids or teens are out there doing the same thing, and the difference is they don't get caught. Secondly, advanced technology is harmful to our society because it takes you away from your family and friends. It makes your family, especially your kids, feel as if you love the computer more than them. It also distances you from your friends. If they invite you to go to the mall or have a drink, you might say you need to check something online. Gradually, they will start to move away from you. You will start to lose the people most important to you, all because of a computer. My last reason why technology can harm society is that it takes you away from living your own life and doing things you want to do. Online, there's a lot of stuff that everyone else says is cool, but you should do what you think and feel is cool. For example, if someone posts saying that @NUM1 guys think London is so cool and you should go there, but you've always wanted to go to @LOCATION1. Another issue is that you don't get enough fresh air outside. Your skin will get pale and unhealthy. In conclusion, although some people might think that advanced technology is good, they're clearly wrong. It opens doors to danger, takes you away from friends and family, and also takes you away from what life has to offer.

Do adults and kids spend too much time on the computer? Well, I don't think they do. Sure, they use it a lot, but it's mainly for entertainment. Kids need to use the computer as it's another excellent way for them to communicate with each other. Texting costs money, and so does talking on the phone. If a kid doesn't have texting, they can use platforms like Facebook to make plans with friends. What if it's a rainy day outside and there's nothing to do? That's exactly what a computer is for. Kids use the computer for a great deal of entertainment. There are tons of games to play, ranging from MMORPGs to RPGs. These games are available on different websites, and they're like a kid's own virtual outside world. Computers are also essential for doing research for school projects. You can find a vast amount of information and get pictures. While there are books, they don't always have everything you're looking for, and you can't cut pictures out of them. To get a good grade on a project, you need the resources that a computer can provide. Therefore, computers need to be used frequently for communication, entertainment, and school projects. They are an integral part of modern - day life for both adults and kids, offering a wide range of benefits that enhance learning and social interaction.

My opinion is that people should have computers in their homes. Computers are incredibly useful and should be utilized for important tasks like searching for jobs and other essential activities. People can efficiently do their work on the computer, which offers a convenient and organized way to complete various tasks. Moreover, it is a great tool for education. Parents can teach their children how to use a computer properly or let their kids go on the internet to search for kids - friendly educational stuff.  However, people shouldn't spend all their time on the computers. Spending excessive time on computers means spending less time with their families and friends. I firmly believe that people should spend more quality time with their families and friends rather than just sitting in front of the computer. But unfortunately, a lot of people use computers almost every day. This might worry their families as they see their loved - ones spending so much time glued to the screen.  People can also share their computer skills with their friends. They can teach their friends how to type on the computer and some interesting facts about history available on the internet. We should ask ourselves if people should spend a lot more time with their families and be truly happy about this time spent together. For instance, when there is a visitor at home, people shouldn't use the computer because it might make the visitor think that they are more attracted to the computer than to the guest.  Computers should give people the ability to learn about faraway places and gain knowledge from the internet. But not everyone agrees that people should use computers. Some are concerned that people can get overly attracted to it. And families are indeed worried about a large number of people using computers so much. On the other hand, other people think that it is a great idea to use computers a lot and spend more time on them than with their families. So, we really need to think about whether people should spend more time with their families and friends instead of focusing all their attention on the computers. In conclusion, while computers offer numerous benefits, we must strike a balance between their use and our real - life relationships.

Dear readers, I think that it's good and bad to use the computer too much. On the one hand, computers bring a great deal of convenience to our lives. We can access a vast amount of information on the internet, which helps us learn new knowledge, keep up with the latest news, and even develop new skills. For students, computers are valuable learning tools that can assist in research and online courses. In the workplace, computers improve work efficiency, enabling us to complete tasks more quickly and accurately.  On the other hand, excessive computer use also has its drawbacks. Spending too much time in front of a computer screen can cause eye strain, back pain, and other health problems. It can also lead to social isolation as people may become so engrossed in the virtual world that they neglect real - life interactions with family and friends. Moreover, the easy access to various forms of entertainment on the computer can be addictive, distracting people from more important things.  In conclusion, we should recognize both the advantages and disadvantages of using the computer too much. We need to use computers in a reasonable way, making full use of their benefits while avoiding the negative impacts. This way, we can ensure that computers enhance our lives rather than cause harm.
